meanings.definition: To eat something quickly and noisily
meanings.sent1: The hungry squirrel gobbles up the nuts in the park.
meanings.sent2: She always gobbles her food when she's in a rush.
meanings.sent3: The little boy gobbles his dinner like a hungry bear.
meanings.sent4: Time gobbles away the moments we have to cherish.
meanings.sent5: The wolf gobbles down its prey in one swift motion.

meanings.definition: The sound made by a turkey
meanings.sent1: We heard the gobbles of the turkeys in the farmyard.
meanings.sent2: The loud gobble echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent3: The comical gobble of the turkey made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The turkey's gobble filled the air with its unique sound.
meanings.sent5: The familiar gobble signaled the start of Thanksgiving.

meanings.sent1: She received a gobbles of presents on her birthday.
meanings.sent2: There was a gobbles of candy at the parade.
meanings.sent3: The gobbles of snow made the children excited for winter.
meanings.sent4: A gobbles of stars lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The garden was filled with a gobbles of colorful flowers.
